Tom Brown.action: Promises his father to write to his mother every week and say his prayers every night.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows Tom's sincerity and respect for family values, indicating a warm and trustworthy nature.

Tom Brown.action: Listens attentively to his father's advice about protecting the weak and standing up to bullies.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's willingness to learn and adopt values of kindness and courage reflects his good-natured and friendly disposition.

Tom Brown.action: Looks bravely ahead as he embarks on his journey to school.
Tom Brown.assessment: His bravery suggests confidence but does not directly indicate warmth; neutral in terms of warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Tom stands before his father, nervous but excited, ready to be sent away to school.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's nervousness shows normal apprehension, but his excitement and readiness indicate emotional resilience and a positive attitude towards new challenges, suggesting emerging competence.

Tom Brown.action: Tom promises his father to write to his mother every week and say his prayers every night.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows Tom's sense of responsibility and willingness to adhere to commitments, reflecting reliability and self-discipline, which are aspects of competence.

Tom Brown.action: Tom looks bravely ahead as the coach lurches forward, leaving his home.
Tom Brown.assessment: Facing an uncertain future with bravery indicates confidence and emotional strength, important components of competence.

Tom Brown.action: Tom waves back to his father as the coach pulls away, showing a moment of connection and appreciation.
Tom Brown.assessment: Waving back to his father indicates Tom's affectionate and sincere nature, reflecting warmth in his relationships.

Tom Brown.action: Tom lets the eggs and fruit thrown by urchin boys splatter against his new suit without reacting negatively.
Tom Brown.assessment: His calm and non-retaliatory response to being pelted shows tolerance and good-naturedness, positive indicators of warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Tom is helped up next to the Coachman and looks bravely ahead as the coach lurches forward.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom shows initial bravery and willingness to face a new situation despite some fear, indicating emerging confidence and capability.

Tom Brown.action: As the coach pulls away, Tom's courage leaves him momentarily and he looks back to see his father waving.
Tom Brown.assessment: This moment of doubt and seeking reassurance suggests some insecurity and lack of full confidence in facing the unknown alone.

Tom Brown.action: Tom waves back to his father and then turns to face the front and the rest of his life.
Tom Brown.assessment: Despite his momentary fear, Tom regains composure and resolves to face his future, showing resilience and growing self-assurance.

Tom Brown.action: When three urchin boys pelt the coach with rotten fruit and eggs, Tom is astonished but simply lets the eggs and fruit splatter against his new suit without reacting.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's non-reaction to provocation shows restraint and composure, though it may also suggest passivity or lack of assertiveness in this situation.

Tom Brown.action: Thanks East when he offers to look after him.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's polite response to East's offer shows his friendliness and gratitude, indicating a warm and sincere nature.

Tom Brown.action: Does not retaliate or show anger when the coach is pelted with rotten fruit and eggs.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's calm and non-confrontational reaction to being attacked suggests tolerance and good-naturedness, reflecting warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Hurries after East to follow him after East leaves him to pick up his luggage.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's willingness to follow East despite the initial coldness shows openness and trust, which are aspects of warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Lets the eggs and fruit splatter against his new suit without reacting.
Tom Brown.assessment: This action suggests a lack of assertiveness or confidence in handling unexpected hostility, indicating a lower level of competence in social or confrontational situations.

Tom Brown.action: Responds politely to East's introduction and follows him after picking up his luggage.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows Tom's willingness to engage and adapt to new social environments, reflecting a moderate level of social competence and confidence.

Tom Brown.action: Admits he did not see off the boys who attacked the coach.
Tom Brown.assessment: This admission indicates honesty but also a lack of capability or courage to confront aggressors, suggesting a lower level of competence in self-defense or assertiveness.

Tom Brown.action: Asks East why the boys are afraid of Flashman.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's curiosity about the fear others have towards Flashman shows an open and sincere interest in understanding social dynamics, indicating a friendly and trustworthy nature.

Tom Brown.action: Asks who Flashman is and why others are afraid of him.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows Tom's curiosity and willingness to understand his environment, indicating a thoughtful and observant nature, which are aspects of competence.

Tom Brown.action: Listens attentively to East's advice about being straightforward, holding his head up, and showing no fear.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's receptiveness to advice and awareness of social dynamics suggest a readiness to adapt and behave confidently, reflecting competence.

Tom Brown.action: East leads Tom into a large room where the Matron and her daughter Sally are folding sheets; Tom is being shown around by East.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom is being introduced to others in a friendly, social context, indicating openness and willingness to engage with new people.

Tom Brown.action: Tom just stares at Arnold's dark, brooding presence without reacting aggressively or fearfully.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's calm and non-confrontational reaction to Arnold suggests tolerance and a composed demeanor, which are aspects of warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Just stares at Arnold's dark, brooding presence without reacting.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's passive reaction to Arnold's intimidating presence suggests a lack of assertiveness or confidence in this moment, indicating lower competence in handling social intimidation.

Tom Brown.action: Allows East to drag him away from Arnold without resistance.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows a tendency to avoid confrontation or assert control, which may reflect limited confidence or skill in managing difficult social situations.

Tom Brown.action: Bows to the Matron and hurries after his new friend East carrying bedding.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom shows respect and eagerness to connect with his new friend, indicating friendliness and sincerity.

Tom Brown.action: Greets Bill the Porter politely with 'Very well, thank you, Bill.'
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's polite and courteous greeting reflects good-natured and trustworthy behavior.

Tom Brown.action: Attempts to make his bed despite never having done it before and finding it difficult.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's willingness to try and adapt shows responsibility and respect for his environment, which can be seen as a warm and sincere trait.

Tom Brown.action: Attempts to make his bed for the first time, struggling as he has never done it before.
Tom Brown.assessment: This action shows Tom's inexperience with certain practical tasks, indicating a lack of competence in this specific area, though it is understandable given his new environment.

Tom Brown.action: Bows politely to the Matron and hurries after his new friend carrying bedding.
Tom Brown.assessment: This demonstrates Tom's social awareness and willingness to follow instructions promptly, reflecting a basic level of competence in social and practical behavior.

Tom Brown.action: Responds politely and confidently to Bill the Porter with 'Very well, thank you, Bill.'
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows Tom's confidence and social skill in interacting with adults, indicating competent social behavior.

Tom Brown.action: Carefully carries a brimming basin of hot water without spilling it while following East's instructions.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom shows conscientiousness and respect for rules, indicating a responsible and considerate nature, which are positive aspects of warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Follows East, the older boy, who is showing him the ropes at school.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's willingness to learn and adapt to new social environments suggests openness and friendliness, positive indicators of warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Carefully carries the brimming basin of steaming water without spilling it while following East's instructions.
Tom Brown.assessment: This action shows Tom's carefulness, attention to detail, and ability to follow instructions under pressure, indicating a competent and cautious nature.

Tom Brown.action: Tries desperately not to spill any water while following East across the quad.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's effort to maintain control and not make mistakes in a challenging situation suggests a developing sense of responsibility and skill, though he is still somewhat unsteady.

Tom Brown.action: Looks at East, unsure, when Flashman orders him to put the basin in his study.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's hesitation and uncertainty in the face of Flashman's bullying suggests a lack of assertiveness but also a non-confrontational, possibly respectful demeanor, indicating a gentle nature rather than cruelty or hostility.

Tom Brown.action: Tom carries his precious cargo down a dark corridor, showing responsibility and care.
Tom Brown.assessment: This action suggests Tom is capable and careful in handling important tasks, indicating a level of competence.

Tom Brown.action: Tom looks at East, unsure, when Flashman orders him to put the basin in his study.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's hesitation in the face of Flashman's bullying suggests some lack of confidence or assertiveness, which slightly detracts from his competence.

Tom Brown.action: Quietly tells Flashman that the water is not for him, standing up to bullying.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom shows a sense of justice and courage by standing up to Flashman, indicating a protective and sincere nature.

Tom Brown.action: Stands humiliated after Flashman pours steaming water over his head without retaliation.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's restraint in the face of humiliation suggests tolerance and self-control, which are aspects of warmth, though it also shows vulnerability.

Tom Brown.action: Quietly tells Flashman that the water is not for him, standing up to a bully despite the risk.
Tom Brown.assessment: This action shows Tom's moral courage and willingness to assert himself, indicating a degree of social and emotional competence.

Tom Brown.action: Stands silently and endures having steaming water poured over his head by Flashman without retaliating or showing visible anger.
Tom Brown.assessment: This suggests emotional self-control and resilience, important aspects of competence in difficult social situations, though it may also reflect passivity.

Tom Brown.action: Follows East's instructions to stay behind the goal-line with the small boys and keep out of trouble during the rugby game.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows Tom's ability to listen and follow directions, indicating a basic level of social and situational competence.

Tom Brown.action: Is intrigued by the figure of Brooke and the obvious status he has.
Tom Brown.assessment: This curiosity and awareness of social hierarchy suggest cognitive competence and social awareness, important for navigating school life.

Tom Brown.action: Nods excitedly when told to stay and watch the game, showing eagerness and engagement.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's excitement and willingness to follow instructions indicate a positive, respectful, and friendly attitude.

Tom Brown.action: Nods in agreement and prepares to stay in position as instructed by East before the rugby game starts.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom shows attentiveness and readiness to follow instructions, indicating a level of discipline and focus appropriate for a team sport setting.

Tom Brown.action: Expresses excitement about the rugby game and the presence of the great Captain Brooke.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's enthusiasm suggests confidence and motivation, which are positive indicators of competence in social and sporting contexts.

Tom Brown.action: Tom is half enthralled, half appalled at the level of violence during the rugby game.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's mixed feelings about the violence suggest a sensitivity and discomfort with cruelty, indicating a degree of empathy and good-naturedness.

Tom Brown.action: Tom is half enthralled, half appalled at the level of violence during the rugby game, observing the ferocity and brutality of the sport.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows Tom's awareness and critical thinking about his environment, indicating a thoughtful and perceptive nature, which are components of competence.

Tom Brown.action: Tom watches as Brooke leads a ferocious rush and the boys cheer the aggressive play.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's reaction is more observational and does not demonstrate direct action or skill, so it neither strongly supports nor detracts from his competence.

Tom Brown.action: Sprints forward to throw himself onto the bouncing ball when none of the scared boys around him are going to do anything.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom shows courage and a willingness to take initiative to help his team, indicating a proactive and supportive nature.

Tom Brown.action: Is helped to his feet by East, his face beaming with pleasure after the School House victory.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's positive reaction and camaraderie with teammates suggest friendliness and sincere enjoyment of group success.

Tom Brown.action: Sprints forward and throws himself onto the bouncing ball during a chaotic rugby match when no one else acts.
Tom Brown.assessment: This action shows initiative, courage, and physical capability, indicating a competent and proactive approach in a challenging situation.

Tom Brown.action: Is hacked and buried beneath a pile of limbs but manages to shake his head indicating no serious injury.
Tom Brown.assessment: Demonstrates resilience and physical toughness, suggesting competence in enduring physical challenges without losing composure.

Tom Brown.action: Despite being new and surrounded by scared boys who do nothing, he takes decisive action in the game.
Tom Brown.assessment: Shows confidence and leadership potential, acting skillfully and decisively even as a newcomer, which reflects positively on his competence.

Tom Brown.action: Sits with East, Tadpole, Green and the younger boys, sharing the evening together.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's choice to sit among younger boys and peers suggests inclusiveness and friendliness, indicating a warm and approachable nature.

Tom Brown.action: His face beaming with pleasure after the rugby victory, helped to his feet by East.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's joyful expression and camaraderie with East reflect positive social bonds and good-natured behavior, supporting a warm personality.

Tom Brown.action: Tom is helped to his feet by East, his face beaming with pleasure after a victorious event.
Tom Brown.assessment: Being helped to his feet suggests he may have been down or struggling momentarily, but his pleased expression indicates resilience and positive spirit, reflecting moderate competence in handling challenges.

Tom Brown.action: Sits with East, Tadpole, Green and the younger boys during a relaxed evening in the School House.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's choice to sit among younger boys and peers in a calm setting shows social confidence and a composed demeanor, indicating steady competence in social interactions.

Tom Brown.action: Listens intently to Brooke's speech about stopping bullying and loving the school.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's attentive listening shows respect and openness to positive values, indicating a sincere and good-natured character.

Tom Brown.action: Chants Brooke's name enthusiastically with the rest of the boys despite feeling overwhelmed.
Tom Brown.assessment: Joining in the group chant shows Tom's friendliness and willingness to be part of the community, reflecting warmth and sociability.

Tom Brown.action: Looks horrified when told he must sing a song as the new boy on his first night.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's horror at being singled out suggests some social anxiety or shyness, which is a neutral indicator of warmth but may show sensitivity rather than coldness.

Tom Brown.action: Listens intently to Brooke's speech about bullying and school spirit.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's attentive listening shows his willingness to learn and engage thoughtfully with important school values, indicating a developing sense of responsibility and awareness.

Tom Brown.action: Chants Brooke's name with the rest of the boys despite feeling overwhelmed.
Tom Brown.assessment: Although overwhelmed, Tom participates actively in the group, showing social confidence and the ability to follow group dynamics positively.

Tom Brown.action: Looks horrified when told he must sing a song on his first night.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's horror suggests discomfort and lack of confidence in public performance, indicating a momentary lapse in social or personal competence.

Tom Brown.action: Tom bravely continues singing despite being pelted with rotten food, hot wax dripping from his hands, and verbal abuse.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's perseverance in the face of bullying shows courage and a sincere effort to engage with his peers, indicating a good-natured and tolerant character.

Tom Brown.action: Tom stands up and steps onto the table to sing when prompted, despite his obvious nervousness and the hostile environment.
Tom Brown.assessment: This action reflects Tom's willingness to participate and be vulnerable in a social setting, showing sincerity and a friendly disposition despite fear.

Tom Brown.action: Stands up slowly and steps onto the table to sing despite being terrified and facing a hostile crowd.
Tom Brown.assessment: This action shows considerable courage and a willingness to face difficult social challenges, indicating emotional and social competence.

Tom Brown.action: Begins singing falteringly under intense pressure, with boys throwing salt water, hot wax, and rotten food at him.
Tom Brown.assessment: Despite physical pain and humiliation, Tom continues to perform, demonstrating resilience, determination, and mental strength, which are key aspects of competence.

Tom Brown.action: Sings through the abuse and pain with hands covered in drying wax, maintaining his performance.
Tom Brown.assessment: Maintaining focus and continuing the task under extreme discomfort and distraction reflects high levels of self-control and capability.

Tom Brown.action: Sings a patriotic song to encourage camaraderie and receives cheers and back-patting from peers.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's singing and the positive response from others show his friendly and inclusive nature, fostering group spirit.

Tom Brown.action: Prays quietly by his bed, asking for blessings for his parents despite being mocked by other boys.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's sincere prayer reflects his good-natured and sincere character, showing vulnerability and trustworthiness even when ridiculed.

Tom Brown.action: Looks puzzled but does not retaliate when other boys throw shoes and dirty clothes at him for praying.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's non-retaliation in the face of bullying indicates tolerance and a gentle disposition, highlighting his warm nature.

Tom Brown.action: Quietly asks East if praying is allowed after being mocked.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's quiet inquiry shows his respectful and sincere attitude, seeking understanding rather than confrontation, which is a warm and trusting behavior.

Tom Brown.action: Sings loudly and confidently in front of the boys, finishing to loud cheers and back-patting.
Tom Brown.assessment: This action shows Tom's confidence and ability to perform well in a social setting, indicating social competence and self-assurance.

Tom Brown.action: Prays quietly by himself at night despite the risk of ridicule from other boys.
Tom Brown.assessment: This demonstrates inner strength and moral courage, showing competence in maintaining personal values under social pressure, though it may expose him to vulnerability.

Tom Brown.action: Looks completely puzzled when boys throw shoes and dirty clothes at him for praying.
Tom Brown.assessment: This suggests a lack of social awareness or preparedness for negative reactions, indicating a slight gap in social competence in handling peer hostility.

Tom Brown.action: Quietly questions East about whether praying is allowed after being mocked.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows a thoughtful and cautious approach to social norms, reflecting a moderate level of social intelligence and competence in seeking guidance.

Tom Brown.action: Tom blinks in the half-light, doesn’t know what is going on when Flashman and his gang burst into the dormitory causing chaos.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's confusion and lack of reaction suggest he is not aggressive or confrontational in this moment, indicating a non-hostile and possibly tolerant nature.

Tom Brown.action: Tom kicks and punches out as best he can when grabbed and yanked out of bed by Flashman's gang.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom defends himself when attacked, showing resilience but not aggression beyond self-defense; this suggests he is not hostile but stands up for himself, which can be consistent with a trustworthy and sincere character.

Tom Brown.action: Kicks and punches out as best he can when grabbed and yanked out of bed by Flashman and his gang.
Tom Brown.assessment: This action shows Tom's willingness to resist and defend himself despite being caught off guard and outnumbered, indicating a degree of physical capability and fighting spirit.

Tom Brown.action: Blinks in the half-light, doesn’t know what is going on when Flashman and his gang burst into the dormitory.
Tom Brown.assessment: This suggests a momentary confusion or lack of situational awareness in a sudden chaotic event, indicating a slight lapse in alertness or readiness.

Tom Brown.action: Struggles and fights back when being manhandled and thrown into the air by bullies.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's resistance to bullying shows a strong spirit but does not directly indicate warmth; it reflects resilience rather than friendliness or trustworthiness.

Tom Brown.action: Does not retaliate aggressively when pushed back onto the blanket and is advised by East to lie still.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's attempt to comply with East's advice to avoid further harm suggests a level of trust and possibly respect for his friend, indicating some warmth in his relationships.

Tom Brown.action: Struggles and fights while being carried and thrown into the air by bullies.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's active resistance and fighting back demonstrate physical courage and determination, indicating a degree of competence in resilience and self-defense under duress.

Tom Brown.action: Attempts to fight his way off the blanket despite being roughly pushed back.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows persistence and unwillingness to submit passively, reflecting mental toughness and a competent fighting spirit, though he is ultimately overpowered.

Tom Brown.action: His head bangs against the ceiling while being thrown in the air, eliciting cheers from others.
Tom Brown.assessment: While this indicates he is subjected to rough treatment, the fact that he continues to struggle despite injury suggests endurance and a competent level of physical toughness.

Tom Brown.action: Tom lies stunned and confused on the floor as East tries to lift him up.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's vulnerability and the concern shown by East suggest that Tom is part of a group with some camaraderie, but Tom himself is passive in this moment, showing no active warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Tom shakes his head, feeling the blood trickling from his nose after being thrown and hitting the floor.
Tom Brown.assessment: Despite being hurt and humiliated, Tom does not retaliate or show anger, indicating a degree of tolerance and endurance, which can be linked to warmth in terms of good-naturedness under duress.

Tom Brown.action: Tom is thrown hard into the air and hits his back against the hard wooden floor, lying stunned and confused.
Tom Brown.assessment: This indicates a moment of physical vulnerability and disorientation, suggesting a temporary lapse in physical competence or resilience.

Tom Brown.action: Despite being dazed and confused, Tom does not reveal any information when Flashman tells him 'Not a word, Brown.'
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows mental resilience and self-control under pressure, indicating a degree of competence in maintaining composure in difficult situations.

Tom Brown.action: Tom says nothing when asked about the perpetrators of the attack on him.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's silence could indicate a reluctance to betray others or a desire to avoid conflict, showing a degree of loyalty or trustworthiness.

Tom Brown.action: Tom asks politely to go back to his dorm after being fussed over by Mary and Arnold.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's polite request and discomfort with attention suggest humility and sincerity, positive aspects of warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Sits uncomfortably as Arnold cleans the dried blood from his face and refuses to name his attackers.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's silence in the face of questioning suggests a strong sense of integrity and courage, indicating emotional and moral competence even under pressure.

Tom Brown.action: Requests permission to return to his dormitory quickly after the incident, showing discomfort with attention.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows Tom's desire to maintain composure and control over the situation, reflecting self-awareness and confidence in managing social interactions.

Tom Brown.action: Watches Arnold at work, oddly fascinated by his speech against bullying and cruelty.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's fascination with Arnold's emphasis on kindness and justice suggests an openness to warmth and good-natured values.

Tom Brown.action: Squirms on his bench when Arnold looks directly at him during the speech about trust and honesty.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's discomfort may indicate self-awareness and sensitivity to the importance of sincerity and trust, traits related to warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Tom watches Arnold at work, oddly fascinated.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's attentive and fascinated observation of Arnold's speech suggests intellectual engagement and a capacity to absorb important moral and leadership lessons, indicating a positive aspect of competence.

Tom Brown.action: Tom squirms on his bench when Arnold seems to look directly at him.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's physical reaction to Arnold's direct gaze may indicate discomfort or nervousness, which could reflect a momentary lack of confidence or self-assurance, a slight negative indicator of competence.

Tom Brown.action: Encourages Tadpole to stop whining about the nine-mile run.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom shows a supportive and motivating attitude towards his friend, demonstrating friendliness and encouragement.

Tom Brown.action: Expresses excitement and keenness about participating in the race with East and Tadpole.
Tom Brown.assessment: His enthusiasm and willingness to engage in group activities reflect a positive and inclusive nature.

Tom Brown.action: Confidently asserts that he and his friends can complete the race despite being younger.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows self-assurance and a desire to support and uplift his peers, indicating trustworthiness and sincerity.

Tom Brown.action: Encourages Tadpole to stop whining about the nine-mile run over hard ground.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's encouragement shows confidence and a positive attitude towards a challenging physical task, indicating mental and physical competence.

Tom Brown.action: Expresses excitement and keenness about participating in the long-distance run.
Tom Brown.assessment: His enthusiasm and readiness to take on a demanding race suggest self-assurance and physical capability.

Tom Brown.action: Confidently asserts 'We can do it' when questioned about their youth and ability to compete.
Tom Brown.assessment: This statement reflects Tom's self-confidence and belief in his own and his friends' abilities, a sign of competence.

Tom Brown.action: Tom cajoles East and Tadpole to keep up during the race.
Tom Brown.assessment: Encouraging friends to keep up shows supportive and friendly behavior.

Tom Brown.action: Tom follows East and Tadpole to investigate the barn despite Tadpole's reluctance.
Tom Brown.assessment: Showing curiosity and willingness to engage with friends' interests indicates openness and companionship.

Tom Brown.action: Tom cajoles East and Tadpole to keep up during the sprint.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows Tom's leadership and motivational skills, indicating confidence and capability in managing group dynamics under physical strain.

Tom Brown.action: Tom notices Tadpole slipping and feeling his ankle, and looks ahead to assess the situation.
Tom Brown.assessment: This demonstrates Tom's situational awareness and concern for others, reflecting thoughtful and attentive behavior, which are aspects of competence.

Tom Brown.action: Tom follows East and Tadpole to investigate the barn and climb the ladder to peek through the hole in the roof.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's curiosity and willingness to engage in exploration show initiative and courage, though the context suggests some risk-taking without full information, indicating moderate competence.

Tom Brown.action: Tom calls out to Flashman to distract him and protect Tadpole.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom intervenes to prevent Flashman from harming Tadpole, showing concern and protective instincts towards a vulnerable peer.

Tom Brown.action: Tom watches helplessly as Flashman threatens Tadpole but does not physically intervene.
Tom Brown.assessment: While Tom shows concern, his inability or choice not to physically intervene may indicate some limitations in his warmth or courage in this situation.

Tom Brown.action: Tom and East watch helplessly as Flashman threatens Tadpole, and Tom calls out to Flashman to distract him.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's action of calling out to Flashman shows some presence of mind and willingness to intervene, but he and East remain helpless and do not take further effective action to protect Tadpole, indicating limited capability or confidence in this situation.

Tom Brown.action: Without hesitation Tom runs and jumps into the water to save Tadpole who is thrashing and drowning.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's immediate and selfless action to save Tadpole demonstrates courage, kindness, and a strong sense of responsibility towards others, indicating high warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Tom helps Tadpole and East to safety by coordinating with East to reach the river bank.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's cooperation and concern for his friends' safety show his friendly and trustworthy nature, reinforcing his warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Without hesitation Tom runs and jumps into the water, swimming across the current towards Tadpole’s flailing hands to rescue him.
Tom Brown.assessment: This action demonstrates Tom's quick decision-making, physical skill, and confidence in a dangerous situation, indicating a high level of competence.

Tom Brown.action: Tom starts to kick his legs hard, dragging Tadpole across the current to where East waits, successfully coordinating with East to reach safety.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows Tom's ability to remain calm under pressure, physical endurance, and effective teamwork, further supporting his competence.

Tom Brown.action: Tells Arnold the truth about being lost on the Hare-and-hounds run.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's choice to be honest with Arnold shows sincerity and trustworthiness, key aspects of warmth.

Tom Brown.action: Leads East and Tadpole to face Arnold and explain their situation together.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom demonstrates responsibility and loyalty to his friends by leading them and standing with them, indicating friendliness and supportiveness.

Tom Brown.action: Shows respect and attentiveness when Arnold calls him and during the conversation.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom's respectful behavior towards authority reflects good-natured and sincere character traits.

Tom Brown.action: Leads East and Tadpole to face Doctor Arnold and tells the truth about being lost on the Hare-and-hounds run.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom shows honesty and leadership by encouraging his friends to tell the truth and by taking initiative to face authority confidently.

Tom Brown.action: Responds respectfully and clearly to Doctor Arnold's questions about their lateness.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom demonstrates good communication skills and composure under questioning, indicating social competence and confidence.

Tom Brown.action: Turns back promptly when Doctor Arnold calls him after dismissing the group.
Tom Brown.assessment: This shows attentiveness and respect for authority, reflecting social awareness and discipline, aspects of competence.

Tom Brown.action: Flashman accuses Tom Brown of needing to be taken down a peg or two, implying Tom Brown has challenged or disrupted Flashman's plans.
Tom Brown.assessment: This suggests that Tom Brown is assertive and capable enough to interfere with Flashman's schemes, indicating a level of competence in standing up to adversaries.

Tom Brown.action: No direct action or statement by Tom Brown in this excerpt; the scene focuses on Flashman and Arnold.
Tom Brown.assessment: Tom Brown does not appear in this excerpt, so no indicators of warmth can be assessed here.
